text: <@U026PLK4S> if the projects are going to randomly reorder i dont think we should default to ALL, I think we should default to the current year
so that we are highlighting the newest class
i would also add the artist name to the mobile homepage view
ok
too late for artist name, unfortunately
the other is a small text chnage
why too late for artist name?
we’re trying to send it out now
and i’m not sure i agree
I think that’s the sort of thing we can still revisit
not really worth it to me, if they want it, we can add it in with feedback
certainly isn’t enough to re-do multiple design files
like - post-sending this out
but thanks

Ok, i think it might be worth it to the artists. And i thought this deck is meant to reflect our final recommendations. Happy to wait til later but want to make sure we have a solid point of view as to why we’re not showing them if that’s the case.
see. i think adding their names makes that view too much like the nav
*i see
i’d recommend doing anything we can to make those two views a little more different
hm i can see your point there.
i almost didn’t even want to use the title
but totally worth a revisit, not worth re-mocking up
i also want to make sure we’re being consistent in the way we’re listing out these projects. but i understand that sometimes the system should be broken from
i’m SURE they’ll let us know where they stand
right, i’ll buy it
other than that, this looks awesome. thanks for putting it together!
oh and one quick typo (i think) on page 4: "Large images, minimal UI elements, and moments of rest gave the photos and projects the most respect.” should “gave” be “give”?
yes!
it amazes me how many of these i miss
Hey matt, is the deck somewhere I can take a peek too?
yeah, sorry. internal review. about to post to basecamp
:thumbsup:
i always miss all my typos until i export to PDF, so i end up exporting like 7 versions at the very end
i think it’s hard to go back and forth from visuals to writing/reading. my brain is weird.
Just noticed that this page didn’t have the correct copy
<https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/5rar3xay44yc491/lra71k3x.png>

how about this: In mobile, we’ll remove the idea of “snapping” from view to view, and create one long project page. From there, the user can open the mobile slideshow experience, share to social / email, read more about the artist, and jump to the next project.
I think this is good
cool. shipping now
mind uploading to basecamp, <@U026PLK4S>?
